description: The 'Lily of the Incas' (Alstroemeria isabellana) is truly an amazing plant, boasting an abundance of beautiful colors and butterfly-like flowers that make a great addition to any garden. Its oval-shaped petals come in vibrant shades of pink and red, topped with delicate yellow and green highlights. The flowers bloom for up to 8 weeks, and its clumps of stems produce leaves that add contrast and texture. This hardy perennial is perfect for borders and beds, and is resistant to deer, drought, and heat. Its sweet, fragrant scent is an added bonus, and its an ideal plant for pollinators. The 'Lily of the Incas' is sure to add beauty and character to any garden.
